availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Tiller Younger (Hopkins Co., KY, student/farm laborer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, student and farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Willis Younger and Margaret B. Younger. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Student and farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 74A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 684.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 810.
